title: Solid HF - reason for bond length vs IMF distance

content.question: The figure above shows that in solid hydrogen fluoride there are two different distances between H atoms and F atoms. Which of the following best accounts for the two different distances?

choices.label: Accommodation of the necessary bond angles in the formation of the solid
Difference in strength between covalent bonds and intermolecular attractions
Different isotopes of fluorine present in the samples
Uneven repulsions among nonbonding electron pairs

content.answer: Difference in strength between covalent bonds and intermolecular attractions
